meanings.definition: To send back or forward for further transportation or delivery.
meanings.sent1: She reconsigns the package to the post office for redelivery.
meanings.sent2: The company reconsigns the goods to a different warehouse for distribution.
meanings.sent3: He reconsigns the lost luggage to the airport, hoping it finds its way back.
meanings.sent4: The email reconsigns the important document to the wrong recipient.
meanings.sent5: The courier reconsigns the fragile package with extra care to avoid damage.

meanings.definition: To assign or transfer to a new destination or recipient.
meanings.sent1: The teacher reconsigns the students to different groups for the project.
meanings.sent2: The manager reconsigns the task to a more experienced employee.
meanings.sent3: She reconsigns the responsibility to her colleague, much to his surprise.
meanings.sent4: The captain reconsigns the mission to a different team for better results.
meanings.sent5: The artist reconsigns the painting to a new gallery for a fresh audience.
